title: Tax Manager, Investments
content:
Summary
The Tax Manager is responsible for evaluating and documenting the appropriate Tax treatment of the new investments, identifying tax risks/costs and reviewing applicable legal documents as well as tax operational onboarding of such new investments.  This position will also be responsible for understanding and documenting accounting treatments as part of initial investment evaluation.   This position will play a significant role in the Company’s ability to expeditiously act on new investment opportunities.   The successful candidate will work with the AVP, Tax in providing timely analysis and documentation with regard to various tax research projects.
Organization
Reports to the AVP, Tax.  This individual will be a subject matter expert and manage this function with no direct reports.
Duties and Responsibilities

Provide tax technical analysis to the AVP, Tax on specific new investments that will support the company’s evaluation of the investment that will include for quantifying and identifying tax risks/costs related to new investments
Prepare tax research memos documenting the tax conclusions, including documenting the understanding of accounting treatment 
Collaborate with AVP, Investment Taxation and other functional areas (e.g. Investment Accounting, Middle Office, Legal, Financial Reporting, Financial Advisory) to perform operational onboarding of new investments
Responsible for reviewing legal documents related to the new investments to provide understanding of the nature of the investment and identify any tax issues that need to be addressed
Provide tax technical analysis on the complex or unusual transactions related to the existing portfolios, including but not limited to derivatives, structured bonds, limited partnerships, hedging, swaps, LITHC, mortgages and alternative investments


Research, analyze, quantify and document tax implications of Company’s material tax positions as well as provide research support for the tax department.
Other duties as assigned

Experience and Education Requirements

Bachelor’s degree in accounting and CPA
Minimum of 7 years of tax experience required with 2 years in a corporate tax department
3 years investment-related tax experience
Requires strong technical skills with respect to the interpretation and application of complex technical matters in the accounting, compliance areas within the Insurance industry
Knowledgeable about tax accounting and compliance issues associated with investments in partnerships and other financial products
Prior experience with reviewing various documents (i.e., partnership agreements, loan documents etc.)
International experience a plus

Skills and Abilities

Strong analytical skills with ability to exercise judgement, present alternatives and make recommendations
Strong organizational and prioritization skills
Strong computer skills
Strong verbal and written communication skills
Ability to effectively work and communicate with various levels of employees and management


Highly motivated, able to work both autonomously and in a team environment and demonstrates the willingness to take on additional responsibility(ies) as needed.


Willingness and enthusiasm to learn/train in skills needed to support the Tax Department
Ability to work under pressure and manage multiple projects

F&G believes in an employee-centric flexible environment, which is why we offer the ability for in-office, hybrid and remote work arrangements. During the hiring process, you'll work with your leader to decide what works best for your role.

About F&G
Since 1959, Fidelity & Guaranty Life Insurance Company (F&G) has offered annuity and life insurance products to those who are seeking security in retirement and protection during life’s unexpected events.
As a national Top Workplace1, an Iowa Top Workplace2 and a proud equal opportunity employer, F&G team members are empowered, collaborative, dynamic and authentic. We believe that by embracing these values, we will continue to build and strengthen the company while continuing to be a great place to work.
